title: Exploring the Timing Effect of Digital Game-Based Learning (DGBL) for STEM Mathematics

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding Basic Mathematical Concepts (Fractions, Geometry, etc.) and Basic Digital Device Skills
context.additional_context: Experimental Application of DGBL to Improve Mathematics Pedagogy for Pre-Service Elementary Teachers or Education Job Seekers

learning_goals: Learners can explain differences in cognitive effects based on game timing (pre/post-class) when applying DGBL to math lessons with over 80% accuracy.
Learners can evaluate associations with collaborative problem-solving patterns by analyzing game log data with 70% accuracy.
Learners can propose over three instructional sequences considering cognitive load and intrinsic motivation factors when designing DGBL.

resources: Licensed Digital Game Platform for STEM Education

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
